name: chasmogamous
content:
Add to word list

Chasmogamous plants have open flowers that can be pollinated (= have pollen taken from one plant or part of a plant to another so that new plant seeds can be produced) by something such as an insect or the wind: A cleistogamous species consists of individuals that produce both chasmogamous (open) and cleistogamous (permanently closed) flowers. All the florets were chasmogamous. Compare
cleistogamous
More examplesFewer examplesMost angiosperms are hermaphroditic and produce only open (chasmogamous) flowers.Viola pubescens (Violaceae) is a perennial herb with chasmogamous and cleistogamous flowers.They conducted an extensive literature survey on germination of seeds from chasmogamous (CH, open) vs cleistogamous (CL, closed, obligately self-pollinated) flowers.
